title: Artifact being used while tapped?

comments.body: I don't recall now, but I also don't recall that mattering. Any artifact tapped (with or without tap symbol) should not be usable, or has that rule changed as well? Or perhaps I remember it incorrectly.
comments.author: [clayton....@ymail.com](https://code.google.com/u/115389003795609959110/)

comments.body:
A tapped artifact cannot activate abilities that require it to tap as part of the cost, other abilities can still be activated. For example, a tapped equipment can still activate its equip ability and be equipped onto a different creature.

**Status:** Invalid
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body:
I wasn't aware of the earlier rules, from what I found out, from Alpha till before Sixth Edition, artifacts stop working when tapped as you mentioned. 

In Sixth Edition, the rules changed to the current one. More details @ http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtgcom/daily/bb15
comments.author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)

comments.body:
Ah, I knew it had something to do with me being old :)
Yes, the old rules was what I was referring to and why I was confused. 
So I guess I'm the only one recently who tried to use Icy to tap an opponent artifact to prevent death, ha. 
Thanks for the note/link.
